abstracts.cdata!:
Although major negative environmental
            impacts are not anticipated as a result of the Education
            Sector Management Reform Project, minor environmental issues
            are expected as a result of the construction, and
            rehabilitation of small rural schools, to be monitored, and
            mitigated, specifically, through the processes of: site
            selection; standard design, and specifications; and,
            construction; the three, included under the project's
            Expansion of Access Component. This environmental management
            plan (EMP) addresses the processes criteria, and outlines
            the following mitigation plan. Sites selection would avoid
            natural vegetation areas, as well as flooding, and/or
            earthquake prone sites. The standard school designs address
            sanitation in particular, to include toilets, and
            appropriate sanitary measures. Furthermore, the use of
            asbestos would be barred, and, although the current scale of
            asbestos use is unknown, existing buildings will be surveyed
            in accordance with applicable laws for safety, and
            environmental risks. Construction contracts would be
            supervised by site engineers, to ensure adequate disposal of
            debris, including toxic residues, oil spillage, and
            hazardous chemicals. Existing lead-based paints will be
            handled in an environmentally safe manner, and, in the
            future, the use of lead-based paints will be discontinued.
            Public awareness campaigns will address health, and hygiene issues.
